name: Uganda Museum
description: The oldest museum in East Africa, showcasing Uganda's cultural heritage, natural history, and traditional music instruments.

name: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
address: Plot 31A & 31B, Wampewo Ave, Kololo, Kampala, Uganda
description: A significant and growing religious community in Uganda, known for its emphasis on family values, community service, and a recently announced temple to be built in Kampala.

name: Kasubi Tombs
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, burial ground for four Kabakas (kings of Buganda) and a significant architectural marvel of organic materials.

name: Nakasero Market
description: A bustling open-air market known for fresh produce, spices, local crafts, and a vibrant shopping experience.

name: Baháʼí House of Worship
address: Kikaya Hill, Gayaza Rd, Kampala, Uganda
description: The Mother Temple of Africa, set in beautiful gardens, offering a tranquil space for prayer and meditation.

name: Independence Monument
description: A prominent landmark symbolizing Uganda's independence, often a site for national celebrations.

name: Crafts Village
description: A vibrant hub for local artisans selling traditional Ugandan crafts, souvenirs, and artworks.

name: Lake Victoria
description: The largest lake in Africa by area, offering boat rides, fishing, and scenic views, a short drive from Kampala.
